title:
Effective density of values of indefinite ternary inhomogeneous
  quadratic forms
abstract:
Given an inhomogeneous quadratic form $Q_\xi(v)=Q(v+\xi)$ with $Q$ an
indefinite $\mathbb{Q}$-isotropic rational ternary form and $\xi\in
\mathbb{R}^3$ irrational, we prove an effective lower bound for the number of
integer vectors $v\in \mathbb{Z}^n$ with $\|v\| \leq T$ such that
$|Q_\xi(v)-t|<\delta$ that is valid for any $t\in \mathbb{R}$ and all
$\delta\geq T^{-\nu}$, with $\nu>0$ depending explicitly on the Diophantine
properties of $\xi$. In particular, for $\xi$ with algebraic entries we can
take any $\nu<\frac{1}{8}$.
